data.text:
LinkedIn and 3rd parties use essential and non-essential cookies to provide, secure, analyze and improve our Services, and to show you relevant ads (including professional and job ads) on and off LinkedIn. Learn more in our Cookie Policy.

Select Accept to consent or Reject to decline non-essential cookies for this use. You can update your choices at any time in your settings.

This Perfect Day Dystopian Novel Analysis by Ralph K Jones - https://lnkd.in/dXwfUxA - This Perfect Day: One Happy Family Right from the beginning of Ira Levin’s This Perfect Day, we learn of a world that is chillingly uniform and impossibly pleasant. There is no war, no hunger, no turmoil of any kind; every single person seems to greatly enjoy their simple lives. Alas, the day could never truly be perfect, and we join the protagonist through a four-part journey of continually seeking out the truth and desperately trying to liberate humanity.
